title: The Influence of social and physical environments upon Harvey's Maturity in Rudyard Kipling's Captains Courageous
abstract: This thesis deals with Kipling's Captains Couraqeous. Rudyard Kipling is one of British writers who lived in the nineteenth century. Captains Couraqeous is hisnovel which was published serially in McClure's Magazine. This thesis shows the power of environments upon someone. Since someone cannot escape from his environments, he depends on the environrnen ts. The re1 ation of environments to human being is so strong that it may affect someone. This thesis will analyze the influence of environments to the main character. Kipling presents Harvey; the main character, as the one who is influenced much by his environments. The writer's primary purpose in writing this thesis is to provide a clear description of the contribution of the environments to Harvey ' s maturity In order to understand how maturity appears in this novel, the writer agrees to analyze both physical and social environments and their influences on Harvey until he reaches his maturity. Above all, through the development of the main character, Kipling's idea about maturity in this novel is revealed.
subjects: ENGLISH FICTION-20TH CENTURY; KIPLING, RUDYARD, 1865-1936. CAPTAIN COURAGERAOUS
